abstract: Lloyd Blankfein of Goldman Sachs, James Dimon of JPMorgan Chase, Kenneth Lewis of Bank of America and Vikram Pandit of Citigroup are among the banking chiefs expected to head to Washington on Friday, where they will meet with President Barack Obama and, most likely, hear him pitch his administration’s plan to repair the nation’s financial system.
snippet: Lloyd Blankfein of Goldman Sachs, James Dimon of JPMorgan Chase, Kenneth Lewis of Bank of America and Vikram Pandit of Citigroup are among the banking chiefs expected to head to Washington on Friday, where they will meet with President Barack Obam...
lead_paragraph: Lloyd Blankfein of Goldman Sachs, Jamie Dimon of JPMorgan Chase, Kenneth Lewis of Bank of America and Vikram Pandit of Citigroup are among the banking chiefs expected to head to Washington on Friday, where they will meet with President Obama and, most likely, hear him pitch his administration’s plan to clean up the financial mess.
